title: js This clarity
message:
the this keyword acts as a shortcut to refer to an object that is the subject in context or the subject of executing code

Use the this keyword for precision

the this reference will always refer to and hold the value of an object singular
Usually used inside a function call or a method
Can still be used outside the function in the global scope
In strict mode this will hold the value of undefined inside the global scope and anonymous functions that aren't bound to an object
this is not assigned a value until an object invokes the function where this is defined
value will always be based exclusively off the value of the object that invoked the function

When not in strict mode the this keyword will refer to the window object that makes up everything inside the global scope, however as stated before when using strict mode using this in the global scope will return undefined

The object that invokes the function is the context but the context can be switched by invoking another the this function with another object and then the new object will become the context

When a method is passed that uses this as a parameter for a callback function things tend to break

when a method is executed on some other object than where the object was originally defined, the this keyword no longer refers to the original object where this was defined, but now it refers to the object that invokes the method where this was defined 
To avoid this problem use the bind keyword on the original object this was used on

closures cannot access the outer functions this variable because the this var is only accessible by the function itself, not by the inner functions

when an inner function tries to access the outer function's this, the this inside the inner function will be bound to the global window object when  strict is not being used
To avoid this problem assign this to a variable to capture the value of this when it refers to the original object context
